item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/10/15/two-factor-authentication/#comment-4266">julien51</a>.
Totally agree on the SMS only thing, it isn't reliable enough. I'd go even further than that, my mobile device shouldn't need connectivity in order to generate a two factor token.
In most cases using something like the <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/google-authenticator/id388497605?mt=8" rel="nofollow">Google Authenticator app</a> is a much better option.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description:
To be honest, as much as I like the idea of 2FA, most of the implementation rely on SMS which is... a bummer. Not only SMS is unreliable, slow and aboslutely not user friendly, but it also fails hopelessly when on travels.
2FA could also work using other types of mechanism: direct messages on social networks for example... or even better; <a href="https://medium.com/@julien51/friendly-auth-e7a7b71edff3" rel="nofollow">friends</a>!
